forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 59. West southwest wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle cloak of patchy drizzle begins to weave through the streets, hinting at the shifting nature of this coastal city. The cloudy skies have wrapped themselves snugly around the skyline, creating an atmosphere that feels intimate yet expansive. With the thermostat resting comfortably around fifty-nine degrees, the light west-southwest winds of ten to fifteen miles per hour, supplemented by occasional gusts, add a whisper of chill to the air—suggesting that while the day may have been sun-kissed, the night holds a different charm.

Those venturing out this evening might consider layering, perhaps a light jacket over a soft sweater to embrace the cool breeze. A stroll through the softly lit streets could be delightful; perhaps meandering through the Civic Center, where the grand architecture stands noble against the dimming sky, or exploring the quiet corners of Golden Gate Park, which begins to exude a serene, otherworldly quality as evening descends. The whispers of the city transition from the hum of daytime activity to the softer cadences of twilight, inviting a bit of reflection or simply the pleasure of your own company among the encroaching fog.
